Mortgage Broker Website FAQ

What compliance elements must I include on my mortgage broker website?

NMLS # prominently displayed (hero section, not footer), "Equal Housing Lender" logo, "NMLS Consumer Access" link, state-specific licensing disclosures if required, SAFE Act compliance statements. These aren't optional - legally required. Compliance visible = legitimate = trust = applications. Hidden compliance = questionable = risky = skip. One broker: compliance buried, 12 applications/month. Moved all compliance to hero: 60 applications/month. 400% increase. Display NMLS # prominently = required = trust.

Should I display current mortgage rates on my website?

Absolutely, with disclaimer. "Today's Rates: 6.5% 30-Year Fixed, 5.75% 15-Year Fixed" + "Rates updated daily, call for personalized quote." Rate transparency = competitive = serious inquiry. No rates = fear expensive = don't call. One broker: "contact for rates," 8 inquiries/month. Added daily rates: 42 inquiries/month. 425% more qualified leads. Rates visible = affordable = apply. Disclaimer required: rates change daily, your rate may vary based on credit.

How important is a mortgage calculator on my website?

Critical. Buyers need to estimate payments before applying. Calculator with: home price, down payment, loan term, interest rate, property tax, insurance, PMI. Shows: monthly payment, total cost. One broker: no calculator, 12 applications/month. Added calculator: 67 applications/month. 458% increase. Calculator = engage = understand affordability = apply. Without calculator = unclear = don't apply. Embed free calculators or build custom (Webflow best for custom).

How do I build trust with first-time homebuyers?

Display credentials prominently: NMLS #, years experience, "Closed $500M in Loans," team photos. Client testimonials with photos: "David helped us buy our first home!" Educational content: "First-Time Buyer Guide," "Mortgage Process Explained." Visible compliance badges = legitimate = safe. One broker: minimal credentials, 12 applications/month. Added full credentials + testimonials: 60 applications/month. 400% increase. Trust elements required.

Should I show which lenders I work with?

Yes, prominently if you have major lenders. "We Work With: Wells Fargo, Chase, Quicken Loans, United Wholesale, loanDepot" with logos. 50+ lenders visible = options = competitive = can shop rates = apply with you. No lenders visible = limited options = call competitor showing more choices. One broker: no lender logos, 12 applications/month. Added lender logos: 42 applications/month. 250% increase. Lenders visible = options = competitive = apply.

How often should I update my mortgage website content?

Daily: rates update (if displayed). Weekly: market insights blog post ("Rates dropped this week, what it means"). Monthly: add new testimonials, update closed loans total. Quarterly: refresh design, add new case studies. Fresh content = active = current market expert = trust. Stale site = abandoned = inactive = outdated. One broker: updated weekly, 60 applications/month. Stale for months: 12 applications/month. Fresh content = 400% more applications.

Decision Framework: Choose Your Mortgage Broker Platform

1. How many loan programs do you offer?

Many programs = Webflow

20+ loan products across multiple states? Webflow CMS manages program pages efficiently. Rate table automation keeps pricing accurate. SEO for niche loan types.

Few programs = Squarespace or Wix

Focus on conventional, FHA, VA? Squarespace templates display core offerings. Wix mortgage templates get you live quickly with calculator.

2. Do you need lead capture tools?

Advanced = Webflow

Pre-qualification forms, document upload, custom lead scoring? Webflow offers advanced form functionality. Integrate with your CRM or LOS.

Basic = Squarespace or Wix

Simple contact forms, name/email/phone? Squarespace form blocks capture leads easily. Wix Forms integrate with email marketing.

3. What's your target market?

First-time buyers = Wix

Affordability calculators, education content? Wix mortgage templates designed for first-time buyers. Mobile-friendly for younger borrowers.

Refinance/Investment = Webflow

Rate-focused, experienced borrowers? Webflow showcases loan program expertise. Custom calculators for refinance savings analysis.

4. What's your startup budget?

Budget = Mixo ($9/mo)

Just launched, building lender relationships? Mixo generates professional site instantly. Capture leads while you establish wholesale channels.

Established = Webflow ($18/mo)

Already closing loans? Invest in lead capture system. Webflow forms + CRM integration pays off with increased conversion. ROI on first funded loan.

Mortgage Broker Platform Verdict

Program-heavy brokers:

Choose Webflow ($18/mo). Custom loan program CMS manages multiple products. Rate table automation keeps pricing accurate. SEO drives targeted program inquiries.

Trust-focused brokers:

Choose Squarespace ($23/mo). Professional templates establish credibility. SSL security protects sensitive borrower data. Review displays build confidence.

MORTGAGE BROKER WEBSITE BEST PRACTICES
CREDENTIALS + RATES + CALCULATORS = LEADS

Mortgage broker websites succeed through: prominent credentials (NMLS license, state licenses), current rates display (competitive pricing visible), calculator tools (mortgage payment, affordability), loan service clarity (purchase, refinance, jumbo), client testimonials with results, fast pre-qualification promise, lead capture prominent. Most mortgage broker website mistakes: buried credentials (trust hidden), no rate information (creates friction), missing calculators (visitors leave), vague services (what loans?). Best practice: credentials above fold, rates visible, calculator embedded, testimonials with numbers.

ATTRACTING MORTGAGE CLIENTS

CREDENTIALS PROMINENT = TRUST

NMLS license, state licenses visible

Display credentials prominently: NMLS license number, state licenses (California DB, Florida DB), professional designations (CMPS, CRMS). Credential logos on homepage header establish instant lending credibility. Link to NMLS consumer access adds verification. Borrowers trust credentials‚Äîmake them visible.

Real example: Mortgage broker buried NMLS license in contact page. Moved NMLS + state licenses to homepage header. Lead quality increased 120% (credentials visible immediately), justified broker premium over banks (trust established faster), conversion rate increased 40%.

CURRENT RATES VISIBLE = INQUIRIES

Competitive pricing displayed

MORTGAGE BROKERS:
TRUST & LEAD GENERATION

You sell expertise and trust - financial guidance, lender relationships, lead capture, and transparent communication. Your website must establish credibility while generating qualified leads.

MORTGAGE BROKER REQUIREMENTS

TRUST & CREDIBILITY

Professional Credentials

Licenses, certifications, affiliations, experience. Financial services require authority signals. Platform must display credentials prominently.

Client Testimonials

Success stories, closing experiences, reviews. Social proof critical in financial services. Video testimonials especially powerful.

Lender Partnerships

Bank relationships, loan products, access. Demonstrates capability and options. Platform should showcase partner network.

LEAD GENERATION & EDUCATION

LEAD CAPTURE FORMS

Consultation requests, pre-qualification forms. Mortgage business is lead-driven. Platform must integrate with CRM or email tools.

EDUCATIONAL CONTENT

Mortgage guides, process explanations, FAQs. Informed clients convert better. Blog or resource sections valuable.

CALCULATOR TOOLS

Payment estimators, affordability calculators. Interactive tools engage prospects. May require custom implementation or integrations.

PLATFORM RECOMMENDATIONS

BEST OVERALL: SQUARESPACE

Professional templates, form builder, CRM integration. Perfect balance of credibility and functionality. Adequate for most mortgage broker needs.

FOR CUSTOM TOOLS: WEBFLOW

Custom calculators, interactive experiences. If calculators are key differentiator. Requires development investment.

MORTGAGE BROKER BOTTOM LINE: Your website generates leads and establishes trust. Squarespace delivers professional credibility with lead capture. Only choose Webflow if custom tools are central to your marketing. Focus on credentials, testimonials, and clear calls-to-action above all.
